meta.title_es: La Mañana de Español de Owen

content.es: Owen se despierta. Es una mañana soleada. "¡Hola, Owen!" dice Plock. Plock es un robot amigo.
content.en: Owen wakes up. It is a sunny morning. "Hello, Owen!" says Plock. Plock is a robot friend.

content.es: Plock tiene una idea. "Vamos a aprender español hoy," dice Plock. Owen está muy feliz. "¡Sí, vamos!"
content.en: Plock has an idea. "Let's learn Spanish today," says Plock. Owen is very happy. "Yes, let's go!"

content.es: Primero, ven los colores. "Mira, Owen," dice Plock. "Tu cama es azul. La pelota es roja."
content.en: First, they see colors. "Look, Owen," says Plock. "Your bed is blue. The ball is red."

content.es: Owen mira la ventana. "El cielo es azul," dice Owen. "Las flores son rojas. ¡Aprendo mucho!"
content.en: Owen looks at the window. "The sky is blue," says Owen. "The flowers are red. I learn a lot!"

content.es: Después, van a la cocina. "Comemos fruta aquí," dice Plock. "La manzana es roja. La banana es amarilla."
content.en: Next, they go to the kitchen. "We eat fruit here," says Plock. "The apple is red. The banana is yellow."

content.es: Owen come una manzana. "¡Qué rico!" dice. "Me gusta la fruta." Plock sonríe.
content.en: Owen eats an apple. "How delicious!" he says. "I like fruit." Plock smiles.

content.es: "Ahora, la familia," dice Plock. "Tu mamá es simpática. Tu papá es alto." Owen asiente.
content.en: "Now, family," says Plock. "Your mom is nice. Your dad is tall." Owen nods.

content.es: Owen está contento. "¡El español es divertido!" dice. "Gracias, Plock, mi amigo." Plock está feliz también.
content.en: Owen is happy. "Spanish is fun!" he says. "Thank you, Plock, my friend." Plock is happy too.

grammar_note: In this story, we use the verb "ser" (to be) to describe what things are. For example, "Plock es un robot" means "Plock is a robot." We also see how adjectives (descriptive words) match the noun they describe in gender, like "La pelota es roja" (The ball is red) where 'roja' ends in -a because 'pelota' is feminine, and "Tu cama es azul" (Your bed is blue) where 'azul' works for both masculine and feminine nouns.
